Configuring the scheduled actions to run
To
automatically perform an action
in the System, you need to configure a schedule for its launch. The start time is set
in CRON format
.
An automatic scheduled action can be created in the number of ways:
In the "Action run schedule" object type
The schedule is set when creating an instance of the "Action run schedule" object type [SYS_ACTION_SCHEDULE] by clicking
.
Where:
Setting
Purpose
Name
Entering the title name.
System action
Selecting a system action to be performed. You need select an action to run on a schedule.
Objects with actions parameters
The field will be available after selecting a value in the "System Action" field.
Selecting an object (of a custom type) with the parameters of the system action specified earlier (described above). The object type is defined as the
name of the system action
.
Action Operation Scheduler
Entering the start period of the algorithm (for more information, see
CRON Scheduler
).
Schedule is valid
Confirming the launch of the system action according to the schedule. Possible values:
yes – the scheduled action is active;
no – the scheduled action is inactive.
The following fields will be filled in automatically by the System:
Setting
Purpose
The last run was successful
Result of running the action. Possible values:
yes – executed successfully;
no – executed unsuccessfully.
Last run date
The date and time of the last run of the action.
If the
run period
is changed in the current schedule, it is necessary to disable and then enable its launch to update the data. You can do that by saving the action run profile with the value "
No
" in the "Schedule is valid" field, then change the value to "
Yes
" in the same field and save it again.
In order to work with the schedule input in the navigation menu of the System (the panel on the left), you need to create a
menu item
.
In the "Launch schedule" object type
In the registry of the "Launch Schedule" object type [SYS_START_SCHEDULE], the user can create several automatic actions in one instance of the type. To do this, go to the object type registry and click
to create a new object.
In the new registry profile you need to fill in the basic settings (name, schedule parameters). The user can configure system actions by clicking
in the "Task Scheduler" child attribute.
After that, a window with possible types of system actions will be displayed on the user’s screen.
After selecting the required action type, the user will see a window with the settings of the system action, which may differ depending on the selected type.
At the end of the schedule configuration, click
to save the data.
The saved system action will be displayed in the task scheduler registry of the schedule profile. Automatic actions will be performed according to the action’s work schedule.
For more information, the process of setting up the launch schedule is described for:
algorithm
;
ETL
;
calculation
.
Other actions are configured in similar way. The number of system actions may vary depending on the increase in the functionality of the System.
